Who Wants to Read?

Posted on March 6, 2014 by Christy Pastore — 6 Comments ↓

Fifteen Weekends is written in third person as a novella. I wrote the story because I often hear people saying how much they love to read, but they just don’t have time for it these days. I understand this statement because for a long time— I was the same way. Who wants to read when there’s a plethora of movies and TV shows running all year long thanks to Netflix, U-verse and basic cable?

Writers are developing short stories and novellas written with 20,000 to 40,000 words for the person who likes reading but simply doesn’t have the time to dive into a lengthy novel. While Fifteen Weekends is considered a full novel based on word count {over 60,000}, it is a satisfying quick read. I didn’t use complex language, just easy to follow dialogue between interesting characters.

Fifteen Weekends is an emotionally charged relatable story that is meant to be read purely for entertainment on a long flight, an even longer car ride or over a weekend. I didn’t aim for a Pulitzer. I simply wanted to share a journey involving three characters filled with romance, drama, mystery and a bit of suspense for a specific audience.

I hope you will enjoy Ashleigh, Emily and Amanda’s stories and how their lives changed over the course of—Fifteen Weekends.
